parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

>  If you do not set this parameter, the system uses **RequestId** as **ClientToken**. **RequestId** may be different for each API request.

parameters.name: DhcpOptionsSetId
parameters.description: The ID of the DHCP options set.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to check the request without performing the operation. Valid values:

**true**: checks the request without performing the operation. The system checks whether your AccessKey pair is valid, whether the Resource Access Management (RAM) user is authorized, and whether the required parameters are set. If the request fails to pass the check, the corresponding error message is returned. If the request passes the check, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.

**false** (default): sends the request. If the request passes the check, a 2XX HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region to which the DHCP options set belongs. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC to be associated with the DHCP options set.
